question:
In context with the recent cabinet approval for Patent Prosecution Highway Program, consider the following statements about its pilot project with Japanese Patent Office:
  1. Getting a technology patented in Japan will automatically get it approved in India.
  2. Both Indian and Japanese patent offices will receive patent applications from all fields under this program.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Patent Prosecution Highway Program was approved by the cabinet in November. A pilot project has been set up to function between the Indian and Japanese patent offices. Under this scheme, getting a technology patented in one country will put it on a fast-track in the other. However, it will not guarantee a patent. Â Statement 2 is incorrect: The Indian Patent Office will receive patent applications only in certain fields under this program: automobile, textiles, electrical, Electronics, Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Civil, Mechanical and metallurgy related applications. The Japanese counterpart, however, will receive applications from all fields.
